Detailed Description

template<typename SizeType>
class boost::details::PODptr< SizeType >

Implemention only.

Member Typedef Documentation

template<typename SizeType>
typedef SizeType boost::details::PODptr< SizeType >::size_type

PODptr is a class that pretends to be a "pointer" to different class types that don't really exist. It provides member functions to access the "data" of the "object" it points to. Since these "class" types are of variable size, and contains some information at the *end* of its memory (for alignment reasons), PODptr must contain the size of this "class" as well as the pointer to this "object".

A PODptr holds the location and size of a memory block allocated from the system. Each memory block is split logically into three sections:
Chunk area. This section may be different sizes. PODptr does not care what the size of the chunks is, but it does care (and keep track of) the total size of the chunk area.
Next pointer. This section is always the same size for a given SizeType. It holds a pointer to the location of the next memory block in the memory block list, or 0 if there is no such block.
Next size. This section is always the same size for a given SizeType. It holds the size of the next memory block in the memory block list.

The PODptr class just provides cleaner ways of dealing with raw memory blocks.

A PODptr object is either valid or invalid. An invalid PODptr is analogous to a null pointer. The default constructor for PODptr will result in an invalid object. Calling the member function invalidate will result in that object becoming invalid. The member function valid can be used to test for validity.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<typename SizeType>
boost::details::PODptr< SizeType >::PODptr ( char *const  nptr,
const size_type  nsize 
) [inline]

A PODptr may be created to point to a memory block by passing the address and size of that memory block into the constructor. A PODptr constructed in this way is valid.

template<typename SizeType>
boost::details::PODptr< SizeType >::PODptr ( ) [inline]

default constructor for PODptr will result in an invalid object.

template<typename SizeType>
size_type boost::details::PODptr< SizeType >::total_size ( ) const [inline]

Each PODptr keeps the address and size of its memory block. The address may be read or written by the member functions begin. The size of the memory block may only be read,

Returns:
size of the memory block.

template<typename SizeType>
bool boost::details::PODptr< SizeType >::valid ( ) const [inline]

A PODptr object is either valid or invalid. An invalid PODptr is analogous to a null pointer.

Returns:
true if PODptr is valid, false if invalid.
